summary: CD-971 is a Warren Commission document that Sir Charles Spry (ASIO) recommended against declassifying in 1968. The document refers to an investigation of anonymous telephone calls to the Canberra Embassy before and after President Kennedy's assassination. Richard Helms acknowledged Spry's recommendation and confirmed that there was no current intention to release the document. The documents consistently show efforts to prevent the declassification of CD-971, suggesting its contents were considered sensitive or potentially damaging.
significance: CD-971's significance lies in its connection to the investigation of anonymous telephone calls to the Canberra Embassy related to the JFK assassination. The efforts to prevent its declassification suggest it contains information deemed sensitive or potentially revealing regarding the events surrounding the assassination.
